title: PLV inscriptions
name: PLV inscriptions
description:
The Roman inscriptions on stone from Hadrian's Wall. 

Markers are colour-coded: green (location certain), yellow (location approximate), and red (precise location uncertain).

Conventions used are as follows: 
[...] = missing portions
[[...]] = deliberate erasure
/ = line break
() = expanded abbreviation
7 = centurial mark – equivalent to c(enturia)
❧ = leaf stop
• = stop

properties.name: RIB 3281
properties.description: ...] / ❧ C[...] / Au[g...] / balin[eum ...] / a sol[o ... ... bath-house ... from the ground up ... Found 1998. Probably late 2nd century AD or later. A bath-house was identified in the civil settlement, near the river, in 1814. Source: RIB III p.281
